text: @eid_cb131cb3 created this channel on 2026-03-21 00:00:00. This is the very beginning of the planning-TableauForecasting channel.

From an engineering perspective, it might be worth discussing the scalability of the tool. @eid_cb131cb3, do you think that's relevant for the report?

- @eid_0c373165 will focus on scalability

From a UX perspective, we should also consider how intuitive the tool will be for users. Maybe we can include a section on user experience goals?

@eid_54b986cf, @eid_839e5084, @eid_73a50f06, @eid_9c876927, @eid_e3612e4a, @eid_bc469a8f, @eid_0dd1bf2e, @eid_3f3ea10f joined planning-TableauForecasting.
Hi team, I want to discuss the Product Requirements Document for TableauForecasting. Let's brainstorm some ideas! ğŸ˜Š
Hey Fiona, sounds good! I think we should start by defining the core functionalities of the AI-powered forecasting tool. What do you all think?
Agreed, George! We should also consider how the UX will support these functionalities. User experience is key! ğŸ‘
Absolutely, Bob. From a QA perspective, we need to ensure that the predictions are accurate and reliable. Maybe we can include some testing scenarios in the PRD?
Great points, everyone! Let's break it down into sections. How about we start with an overview, then move on to user stories, technical requirements, and finally, testing and validation?
Sounds like a solid plan, Fiona. I'll take the lead on drafting the technical requirements. @eid_0c373165, can you help with the user stories?
Sure thing, Fiona D! I'll start drafting some user stories by the end of this week. @eid_272ed674, could you provide some insights on user personas?
On it, George! I'll have some initial personas ready by Thursday. @eid_839e5084, when can you start on the testing scenarios?
I can start working on them next week. I'll aim to have a draft by Wednesday. @eid_54b986cf, do we have a deadline for the PRD?
Let's aim to have the first draft ready by the end of next week. That should give us enough time to review and iterate. ğŸš€
Perfect, that timeline works for me. I'll be available for any QA reviews needed. ğŸ˜Š
Thanks, everyone! Let's keep the momentum going. Feel free to drop any questions or updates here. ğŸ™Œ
Looking forward to seeing everyone's contributions! Let's make this a great product. ğŸ’ª
